table-wrap-foot.p: All data shown are mean (SD) except gender.
In bold characteristics that significantly differed between groups.

HADS Hospital anxiety and depression scale, MMSE Mini-mental state examination, MOCA Montreal cognitive assessment, UPDRS Unified Parkinson’s Disease Rating Scale, LEDD Levodopa Equivalent Dose, RBDSQ REM sleep behaviour disorder scale.
aBest binocular score used; LogMAR: lower score implies better performance, Pelli–Robson: higher score implies better performance.
bStatistically significant difference between PD and controls.
cStatistically significant difference between PD high visual performers and PD low visual performers.
dHigher values imply worse image quality.
eHigher values imply better image quality.

extracted-table.table-caption: Neurotransmitter receptor genes correlating with the change in structural–functional connectivity coupling in PD.

caption.p: Neurotransmitter receptor genes correlating with the change in structural–functional connectivity coupling in PD.

tr.th: Genes correlated with structural–functional connectivity decoupling in PD compared to controls
Genes correlated with structural–functional connectivity decoupling in PD low visual performers compared to PD high visual performers

table-wrap-foot.p: Note that correlation coefficients of absolute values between 0.1 and 0.4 represent moderate correlation in our dataset. In all cases, gene expression levels were significant in spatial permutation testing (p-spin < 0.001).
CHRNA Nicotinic Cholinergic Receptor (Alpha), DRD Dopamine Receptor D, HTR 5-Hydroxytryptamine Receptor, ADRA Alpha-1A adrenergic receptor.
